content:
I'm excited to get started with tracking my sleep quality and using the Hatch Rest Sound Machine to improve my sleep. I'm planning to use the machine to create a consistent sleep environment and help me fall asleep faster. I've heard that it's essential to establish a relaxing bedtime routine, so I'm going to try to wind down before bed by reading a book or listening to calming music.

As for sleep goals, I'm aiming to get at least 7-8 hours of sleep each night and improve the quality of my sleep. I've noticed that I often wake up feeling groggy and tired, so I'm hoping that by tracking my sleep and making adjustments to my sleep habits, I can wake up feeling more refreshed and energized.

Do you have any tips on how to establish a consistent sleep schedule and create a sleep-conducive environment? I've heard that things like keeping the room cool, dark, and quiet can help, but I'm not sure where to start.
